summary: Max Ferdinand Perutz FRS OM CBE  was an Austrian-born British molecular biologist.
full_text: Max Ferdinand Perutz OM CH CBE FRS  was an Austrian-born British molecular biologist, who shared the 1962 Nobel Prize for Chemistry with John Kendrew, for their studies of the structures of hemoglobin and myoglobin. He went on to win the Royal Medal of the Royal Society in 1971 and the Copley Medal in 1979. At Cambridge he founded and chaired  The Medical Research Council Laboratory of Molecular Biology, fourteen of whose scientists have won Nobel Prizes. Perutz's contributions to molecular biology in Cambridge are documented in The History of the University of Cambridge: Volume 4  published by the Cambridge University Press in 1992.
title: Max Perutz
